content: Do we have a breakout schedule for connectathon 24? I'm thinking of just a centralized list of specific zoom teleconferences with given topics and times. Does this already exist?

I think the idea was for each track to have it's own zoom to use how it sees fit - plus a common one for 'communal' events. But the idea of a central page where the times, subjects and zoom address sounds like a great idea to me. How does this page work?

(David, thanks for creating this page!)

It has no entries, I'm trying to guide a couple of learners as they're introduced to FHIR connectathons during our first ever virtual connectathon. Any suggestions for me?

What are you wanting to do? The idea was that if you are setting up a zoom session for your track - say to discuss something that has arisen during the connectathon, that you put the details on this page. That way, if there are others interested in that topic they would be able to tune in...

One thing we haven't discussed @Sandra Vance is a basic FHIR tutorial at the beginning. @Richard Ettema generally gives it I believe. Perhaps we could decide on a time (or times) for that and add to the page?

Hello all! The Main Connectathon Go To Webinar will have the typical "all hands" sessions. The kick off and wrap up, Richard's Intro to FHIR and Tooling sessions, and 15 minute "sharing" sessions for any track who wants to sign up. Each Track Lead will be given zoom credentials to run their zoom for their own track and you are encouraged to schedule at least two "status" sessions where people who are not on for the entire time can check in. All meeting credentials will be sent out Wednesday morning. We will publish the list of all tracks with their respective chat stream and zoom links listed as well. That will come out via email Wednesday morning also.

So in essence - since breakouts can be handled via zoom - there is not a break out session. However there is an opportunity for tracks to schedule time to engage the broader connectathon community with their track and share info for newbies. Those sessions will also be recorded. https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1P4EPT2Hi3PI9eB-TYPj5xYHzInZS4ixd/edit#gid=510880158
Sandy currently has me scheduled to give the "FHIR Overview" presentation on Thursday 5/14 at 9:00am.
Can I suggest that people are as descriptive as possible? For example there is an entry at 11am on the thursday that just says 'FHIR tools', but not what the purpose of the meeting is...
The only tool that @David Hay will require at that time is an alarm clock!
You're assuming that I won't be already awake (working of course) at that hour in NZ?

Instead of "matchbox", how about Flint and Steel?
"FHIR Tools" - that's me again, needs to be updated to "FHIR Testing Tools - Intro to Touchstone".
